result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael S. GRANT

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
The State moves to dismiss and read in.  The defendant plead to charges in 15 CM 169.  Motion granted.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.
The defendant rejects the States offer and asks for a trial date.
Pretrial conference is set for 09-02-15 at 8:30 a.m.
Jury trial is set for 09-09-15 at 8:30 a.m. no: 1 position.
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-10-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Plea date is set for 06-03-15 at 10:00 a.m.   Bail is set at $350.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail furnished.   
Minutes.

RE:  Deputy Radke, on 01-07-15.
Initial appearance is set for 03-02-15 at 1:30 p.m.
